title: LLM Self-Scheduling Solutions
body_html:
LLM Self-Scheduling Solutions

Overview

This document outlines various approaches for implementing a system that allows LLMs (Large Language Models) like Letta to schedule their own future actions without human intervention. The core concept is to enable LLMs to:

  1. Create calendar entries or scheduled tasks for specific future times
  2. Have those entries trigger webhooks or other notification mechanisms
  3. These notifications then trigger n8n workflows
  4. The workflows send requests to the Letta server
  5. This activates the LLM to perform the scheduled task autonomously

Implementation Options

1. Direct Google Calendar + n8n Integration

Description: Leverage Google Calendar's API through n8n to create and manage scheduled events.

Components:

  • Google Calendar for event storage and management
  • n8n's Google Calendar integration for programmatic event creation
  • Google Calendar notifications/webhooks to trigger when events occur
  • n8n workflow to process calendar events and trigger Letta

Self-hostability:

  • n8n is fully self-hostable
  • Google Calendar isn't self-hostable, but can be replaced with:
    • NextCloud Calendar (open-source, self-hostable)
    • Radicale (lightweight CalDAV server)

Advantages:

  • Visual interface to see all scheduled tasks
  • Familiar calendar interface
  • Robust API and webhook support
  • Integrates with existing calendar systems

Implementation Complexity: Moderate

2. Cal.com with Customization

Description: Adapt Cal.com's scheduling system to allow LLMs to create automated task events.

Components:

  • Cal.com for event scheduling
  • Cal.com webhooks to notify of event creation/occurrence
  • n8n workflow to process these notifications
  • Custom API integration to allow LLMs to create events

Self-hostability:

  • Cal.com offers an open-source version that can be self-hosted

Advantages:

  • Polished user interface
  • Already integrated with Google Calendar
  • Built-in notification system

Implementation Complexity: High (requires significant customization)

3. Dedicated Scheduling Services

Description: Use specialized workflow orchestration platforms designed for scheduling future tasks.

Options:

  • Temporal.io

    • Workflow orchestration platform
    • Designed for scheduling and executing future tasks
    • Open-source and self-hostable

  • Inngest

    • Event-driven workflows with scheduled functions
    • Has self-hosted option

Advantages:

  • Purpose-built for scheduling automated actions
  • Robust handling of failures and retries
  • Designed for production workloads

Implementation Complexity: Moderate to High

4. Simple Cron-based Solution

Description: Create a custom lightweight solution using cron jobs and a database.

Components:

  • Database to store scheduled tasks (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite)
  • Cron job to check this database periodically
  • Script to trigger n8n workflows when a task's time arrives

Self-hostability:

  • Fully self-hostable by design
  • Can run on any Linux server

Advantages:

  • Complete control over implementation
  • Very straightforward architecture
  • Minimal dependencies
  • Lightweight

Implementation Complexity: Low

5. Message Queue with Delayed Delivery

Description: Use message queuing systems that support delayed message delivery.

Options:

  • RabbitMQ

    • Open-source message broker
    • Supports delayed message delivery via plugins
    • Self-hostable

  • Redis

    • In-memory data structure store
    • Can implement delayed tasks with sorted sets
    • Open-source and self-hostable

  • Apache Kafka

    • Distributed event streaming platform
    • Can implement timing with additional components
    • Self-hostable

Advantages:

  • Reliable and scalable
  • Designed specifically for delayed execution
  • Well-documented with strong community support

Implementation Complexity: Moderate

6. Node-RED

Description: Alternative to n8n with strong scheduling capabilities.

Components:

  • Node-RED as the workflow automation platform
  • Built-in scheduling nodes
  • HTTP request nodes to trigger Letta

Self-hostability:

  • Fully open-source and self-hostable

Advantages:

  • Visual flow-based programming
  • Excellent scheduling capabilities built-in
  • Large library of community nodes

Implementation Complexity: Low to Moderate

7. Apache Airflow

Description: Powerful workflow scheduler originally designed for data pipelines.

Components:

  • Airflow for workflow scheduling and management
  • DAGs (Directed Acyclic Graphs) to define task workflows
  • HTTP operators to trigger Letta

Self-hostability:

  • Open-source and self-hostable

Advantages:

  • Extremely powerful scheduling capabilities
  • Robust monitoring and logging
  • Strong retry and error handling

Implementation Complexity: High

Recommended Approach

For the specific use case of allowing LLMs to schedule their own future actions, the Simple Cron-based Solution or Direct Google Calendar + n8n Integration would likely provide the best balance of functionality and implementation simplicity.

The cron-based solution offers complete control and minimal dependencies, while the Google Calendar integration provides a better visual interface and integrates with existing calendar systems.
